intro: Cacalia triflosculosa, commonly known as the three-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Cacalia triflosculosa is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
